question:
A company has NFS servers in an on-premises data center that need to periodically back up small amounts of data to Amazon S3.

Which solution meets these requirements and is MOST cost-effective?

options.A: Set up AWS Glue to copy the data from the on-premises servers to Amazon S3.
options.B: Set up an AWS DataSync agent on the on-premises servers, and sync the data to Amazon S3.
options.C: Set up an SFTP sync using AWS Transfer for SFTP to sync data from on premises to Amazon S3.
options.D: Set up an AWS Direct Connect connection between the on-premises data center and a VPC, and copy the data to Amazon S3.

explanation: AWS DataSync is the most cost-effective solution for periodically backing up small amounts of data from on-premises NFS servers to S3. It's designed specifically for data transfer tasks, supports NFS, and is more cost-effective than Direct Connect for small periodic transfers.
